definition.text: This is like the low-level part of the Design Space. It features a physics engine that governs the physical interactions of floating objects.

paragraphs.text: At runtime, each node on the Design Space behaves like a molecule featuring three atoms working together: the first one is called Floating Object and belongs to the Floating Space, which controls its position and collision-related physics; the second one is a UiObject which lives at the Design Space and controls the UI of the node, including menu, label, etc.; the third one is a Node that is—essentially—the information contained in that node.
When you save the Workspace, Floating Objects and UIOBjects are detached from Nodes, and saved as a big JSON object with only its data.
